caption.title: Comparing two metrics for model comparison: AIC and five-fold cross-validated log likelihood.
caption.p: Each comparison is between the main version of the resource-rational model, Equation (11), and the model listed in the first column of the table. Negative AIC differences and positive cross-validated log likelihood differences indicate an advantage of the resource-rational model over the alternative model. In all comparisons, these differences have opposite signs, which means that the AIC-based results are consistent with the cross-validation results.

tr.th: Model with which the main model is compared

tr.td: Rational model variant: cbehavioral as in Sims (2015)
